results.title: Begone dull care
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Evelyn Lambart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A lively interpretation of jazz music played by the Oscar Peterson Trio. The music is visually represented in a series of abstract lines and shapes, hand painted directly on to the film, culminating in a fast and furious explosion as the tempo quickens. One of the high points of jazz in cinema (and of McLaren’s career).

results.title: Land use and abuse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of careless land development on the Tasmanian environment and goes on to stress the need for conservationists and developers to work together. Narrated by Stewart Faichney.

results.title: In partnership with the people
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasmania. Dept. of Film Production
results.brief_description: Battery Point is one of the oldest parts of Hobart and the City Council is about to put into practice a development plan which will retain the character and charm of this area. Shows the signal station, the seamen’s cottages, the fine houses of the wealthy, Kelly’s Steps, St George’s Church and other historic items.

results.title: A Changing Perspective
results.brief_description: This film covers the widening interests of the Australian Paper Mills company. An historical background is given and the present main interests of the company, forestry, paper and pulp are documented. New projects include a diverse range of activities such as paper, plastic and metal packaging

results.title: The Telegram Man
results.creator_credit: Victoria Wharfe McIntyre, Ceinwen Berry and James Khehtie
results.brief_description: Multi-award-winning film ‘The Telegram Man’ poignantly depicts the human cost of war in its portrayal of relationships impacted by the vicissitudes of wartime. Featuring restrained but deeply emotional performances from some of Australia’s finest screen actors (Jack Thompson, Gary Sweet and Sigrid Thornton), this is a powerful film about loss, grief and duty.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.creator_credit: Tessa Laing and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: ‘Survival of the Fittest’ constructs the core message that human genetics should not be altered, despite good intentions. Based on a scientific theory by Herbert Spencer that relates to how organisms evolve over time to develop desirable traits. The film explores how scientists can artificially replicate a natural process, which can lead to a negative outcome.

results.title: Parents!
results.brief_description: Britannia Butwell believes her parents are embarrassing and wishes for an exchange. That is, until she meets Sandra Sandman. Could Sandra be able to change Britannia’s mind?

results.title: Novo
results.brief_description: After a catastrophic accident, a cloned boy aboard a spaceship finds himself lost in an unknown yet familiar place. He must come to terms with the change of lifestyle and adapt to it. Along the journey he meets some new friends and helps them as best he can.

results.title: A Notable tree
results.brief_description: This is the story of a boab tree in Darwin, enduring the test of time, witnessing the changes that take place around it. As it ages, it becomes a monument of nature and a symbol of survival through the history of Darwin. The Adonsonia Gregorii is a bottle-shaped tree endemic to Australia. Some trees can live over one thousand years. Some refer to them as “The Tree of Life”.

results.title: KnightGame
results.creator_credit: Belmont High School, Logan Bryce, Angus Latham and Ewan Breakey
results.brief_description: ‘KnightGame’ is a Medieval local multiplayer battle arena, where any stab, shield or shot could be your last. Purchase items at your base to change, strengthen and morph you and your army into fearsome warriors, then march into battle and destroy your opponent’s base to claim victory. But be wary, not all items are created equal and many will hinder you.
